explanation: The report is correct. strlen(c->rq.method) is called with only an mhd_assert(NULL != c->rq.method) as a precondition; there is no evidence in the snippet that the object c->rq.method points to is NUL-terminated within its allocated bounds. MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 prohibits use of <string.h> functions that may access beyond the referenced object. An assertion that the pointer is non-NULL does not guarantee a NUL terminator (and assertions may be omitted in production builds), so the strlen call can potentially read past the object and thus violate Rule 21.17. (If, elsewhere in the program, it is provably guaranteed that c->rq.method is NUL-terminated whenever http_mthd == MHD_HTTP_MTHD_OTHER, then the violation would not hold — but no such guarantee is present in the provided code, so the agent’s report is correct.)
